Desc.entry: Heritage open days celebrate England's architectural heritage and culture by offering free access to properties that are usually closed to the public or normally charged for admission. Every year in September buildings of every age, style and function throw open their doors, ranging from castles to factories, town halls to tithe barns, parish churches to buddhist temples. Once a year chance to discover hidden archaeological treasures and enjoy a wide range of tours, events and activities which bring to life local history and culture.
